name: Obudu Mountain Resort
description: A breathtaking mountain resort with stunning views, cable cars, and natural swimming pools. Located 1,576 meters above sea level with a temperate climate.

name: Yankari Game Reserve
description: Home to a wide variety of wildlife including elephants, lions, and baboons, with natural warm springs perfect for relaxation.

name: Erin Ijesha Waterfall
description: A spectacular seven-level waterfall with natural pools perfect for swimming and relaxation. Also known as Olumirin Waterfall.

name: Lekki Conservation Centre
description: A nature reserve with a famous canopy walkway, wildlife viewing, and beautiful landscapes in the heart of Lagos.

name: Zuma Rock
description: A massive monolith that stands out prominently in the landscape, often called the 'Gateway to Abuja'. It rises 725 meters above the surroundings.

name: Gurara Waterfalls
description: A majestic waterfall with a drop of about 30 meters, surrounded by beautiful scenery and perfect for picnics and relaxation.

name: Idanre Hills
description: A stunning collection of hills with 660 steps leading to the top, offering breathtaking views and historical significance.

name: Oguta Lake
description: The largest natural lake in Imo State, known for its confluence of blue and green waters that never mix.

name: Ikogosi Warm Springs
description: A unique natural phenomenon where warm and cold springs meet but never mix, creating a fascinating tourist attraction.

name: Olumo Rock
description: A massive granite outcrop that served as a natural fortress during tribal wars, now a major tourist attraction with historical significance.

name: Nike Art Gallery
description: One of Africa's largest art galleries, showcasing Nigerian art, crafts, and cultural heritage across multiple floors.

name: Millennium Park
description: The largest public park in Abuja with beautiful gardens, walking trails, and recreational facilities.

name: Kainji National Park
description: Nigeria's second largest national park featuring diverse wildlife, the Kainji Dam, and beautiful landscapes.

name: Awhum Waterfall
description: A stunning waterfall flowing through a cave with spiritual significance and therapeutic properties.

name: Kajuru Castle
description: A medieval-style castle offering unique accommodation and stunning views of the surrounding landscape.

name: Osun-Osogbo Sacred Grove
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring sacred forest, sculptures, and shrines dedicated to the Osun goddess.

name: Agbokim Waterfalls
description: A cascade of seven waterfalls flowing side by side, creating a breathtaking natural spectacle.

name: Arinta Waterfalls
description: A serene waterfall nestled in lush vegetation, perfect for relaxation and nature appreciation.

name: Sukur Cultural Landscape
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site showcasing ancient settlement patterns and traditional iron-smelting techniques.

name: Eyo Festival Grounds
description: The historic venue for Lagos Island's famous Eyo Festival, showcasing Yoruba culture and traditions.

name: Mambilla Plateau
description: Nigeria's highest plateau with cool climate, rolling hills, and stunning landscapes perfect for tourism.

name: Farin Ruwa Falls
description: One of the highest waterfalls in Nigeria, dropping over 150 meters into a gorge surrounded by savannah.

name: Tarkwa Bay Beach
description: A serene beach accessible by boat, offering calm waters perfect for swimming and water sports.

name: Eleko Beach
description: A popular beach destination with clean sands, beach resorts, and various recreational activities.

name: National Museum Benin
description: A museum showcasing the rich cultural heritage and bronze works of the ancient Benin Kingdom.

name: Matsirga Waterfalls
description: A beautiful waterfall in a remote location, offering adventure seekers a rewarding trekking experience.

name: Okomu National Park
description: A protected rainforest reserve home to diverse wildlife including elephants, leopards, and primates.

name: Ngwo Pine Forest
description: A picturesque pine forest with scenic views, caves, and a beautiful waterfall.

name: Abraka Beach
description: A serene riverside beach with golden sands and calm waters perfect for relaxation.

name: Tinapa Resort
description: A business and leisure resort featuring shopping, entertainment, and recreational facilities.

name: Owu Waterfalls
description: A magnificent waterfall requiring a challenging hike, rewarding visitors with stunning natural beauty.

name: Ibeno Beach
description: One of the longest sand beaches in West Africa with pristine white sands and clear waters.

name: New Calabar River
description: A scenic river with mangrove forests, perfect for boat tours and experiencing coastal ecosystems.

name: Azumini Blue River
description: A unique blue-colored river with pristine waters, surrounded by lush vegetation.

name: Nana Living History Museum
description: A living museum showcasing Hausa-Fulani culture, traditional crafts, and architectural heritage.

name: Kamuku National Park
description: A vast national park with diverse wildlife, including elephants, buffaloes, and various antelope species.

name: Abubakar Tafawa Balewa Stadium
description: A modern sports facility hosting various sporting events and cultural activities.

name: Emir's Palace Kano
description: A magnificent 15th-century palace showcasing traditional Hausa architecture and royal heritage.

name: Kwa Falls
description: A powerful waterfall with multiple cascades and natural pools for swimming.

name: Assop Falls
description: A scenic waterfall on the Jos Plateau with cool climate and beautiful surroundings.

name: Gashaka Gumti National Park
description: Nigeria's largest national park with diverse ecosystems, including mountains, forests, and savannahs.

name: Oke Maria Shrine
description: A Catholic pilgrimage site on a hilltop offering spiritual experience and panoramic views.

name: Badagry Heritage Museum
description: A museum documenting the history of the trans-Atlantic slave trade in Nigeria.

name: Sambisa Forest Reserve
description: A large forest reserve with diverse wildlife and natural landscapes for eco-tourism.

name: Afi Mountain Wildlife Sanctuary
description: A sanctuary protecting endangered Cross River gorillas and other rare wildlife species.

name: Arochukwu Long Juju Slave Route
description: A historical site showcasing the dark history of slave trade and traditional oracle worship.

name: Obudu Cattle Ranch
description: A scenic cattle ranch on the Obudu Plateau with cool climate and beautiful landscapes.

name: Benin City Moat
description: Ancient earthwork fortifications built around the old Benin Kingdom, a testament to pre-colonial engineering.

name: Cross River National Park
description: One of Africa's oldest rainforests with incredible biodiversity and rare primate species.

name: Mapo Hall
description: A historic building in Ibadan offering panoramic views of the city and colonial architecture.

name: Oke Ado Mountain
description: One of Ibadan's highest points offering spectacular views of the city and surrounding areas.

name: Calabar Carnival Route
description: The vibrant route of Africa's biggest street party, the Calabar Carnival, held annually in December.

name: Chad Basin National Park
description: A national park protecting the unique ecosystems around Lake Chad with diverse wildlife.

name: Nike Lake Resort
description: A beautiful man-made lake with resort facilities, perfect for relaxation and water activities.

name: Shere Hills
description: Rocky hills offering challenging climbs and breathtaking views of the Jos Plateau.

name: La Campagne Tropicana Beach Resort
description: An upscale beach resort offering African cultural experiences and modern amenities.

name: Ogbunike Caves
description: A network of caves with cultural and spiritual significance, featuring stunning rock formations.

name: Wonderland Amusement Park
description: A family-friendly amusement park with rides, games, and entertainment for all ages.

name: Aso Rock
description: An iconic 400-meter monolith and the landmark of Nigeria's capital city.

name: Ladi Kwali Pottery Centre
description: A cultural center dedicated to traditional pottery and ceramic arts of Nigeria.

name: Olusegun Obasanjo Presidential Library
description: A presidential library and museum showcasing Nigeria's democratic journey and history.

name: Jebba Dam
description: A hydroelectric dam on the Niger River offering scenic views and boat rides.

name: Riyom Rock Formation
description: Unique rock formations creating natural sculptures across the Jos Plateau landscape.

name: Bar Beach
description: A popular urban beach in Lagos with vibrant atmosphere and beachfront activities.

name: Kano City Wall
description: Ancient city walls dating back to the 14th century, showcasing medieval defensive architecture.

name: Ikogosi Resort
description: A modern resort built around the famous warm springs, offering luxury accommodation and spa.

name: Awhum Monastery
description: A Catholic monastery near Awhum Waterfall offering spiritual retreat and pilgrimage.

name: Shitta Bey Mosque
description: One of the oldest mosques in Lagos with Brazilian-influenced architecture.

name: Jos Wildlife Park
description: A wildlife park housing various animal species in a natural setting with cool climate.

name: Oke Itase
description: The legendary spot where the Yoruba believe humanity began, with deep cultural significance.

name: Kurra Falls
description: A beautiful waterfall cascading down rocky terrain on the Jos Plateau.

name: Old Oyo National Park
description: A national park featuring the ruins of Old Oyo Empire and diverse wildlife including elephants.

name: Millennium Tower
description: A modern skyscraper offering panoramic views of Abuja's skyline and landmarks.

name: Falgore Game Reserve
description: A protected area with diverse wildlife and natural habitats in Northern Nigeria.

name: Port Harcourt Tourist Beach
description: A popular beach destination with facilities for relaxation and water sports.

name: Alok Ikom Monoliths
description: Ancient carved stone monoliths dating back over 2,000 years, shrouded in mystery.

name: Kogi Confluence
description: The spectacular meeting point of River Niger and River Benue, creating a unique natural phenomenon.

name: Awhum Cave
description: A massive cave system with underground streams and religious significance.

name: Lekki Arts and Crafts Market
description: A vibrant marketplace showcasing Nigerian arts, crafts, and cultural artifacts.

name: Rima River Valley
description: A scenic river valley with agricultural lands and traditional fishing communities.

name: Ajonoku Beach
description: A serene beach perfect for swimming and relaxation away from city crowds.

name: Gidan Makama Museum
description: A museum housed in a 15th-century palace showcasing Kano's rich history and culture.

name: Ado Awaye Suspended Lake
description: One of only two suspended lakes in the world, perched on top of a mountain.

name: River Ethiope Source
description: The source of the deepest inland waterway in Africa, bubbling up from underground in a pristine forest setting.

name: Abraka Turf and Country Club
description: A recreational facility with golf course, swimming pools, and resort amenities.

name: Kebbi State Argungu Fishing Festival Site
description: The venue for Nigeria's famous annual fishing festival featuring traditional fishing competitions.

name: Nok Village
description: The archaeological site where the ancient Nok terracotta sculptures were discovered.

name: Badagry Black Heritage Museum
description: A museum dedicated to preserving the memory of the Atlantic slave trade.

name: Sombreiro River
description: A scenic river perfect for boat tours and experiencing coastal ecosystems.

name: Jos Museum
description: Nigeria's first museum featuring traditional Nigerian architecture and extensive artifact collections.

name: Bamenyan Hot Springs
description: Natural hot springs with therapeutic properties in a serene mountain setting.

name: Anambra River Basin
description: A scenic river basin with agricultural lands and traditional fishing communities.

name: Abubakar Tafawa Balewa Tomb
description: The final resting place of Nigeria's first Prime Minister with memorial facilities.

name: Ojukwu Bunker
description: A historical bunker from the Nigerian Civil War with underground tunnels and exhibitions.

name: Kofar Mata Dye Pits
description: Ancient dye pits still in use today, showcasing traditional textile dyeing techniques dating back 500 years.

name: Pandam Wildlife Park
description: A wildlife park with diverse animal species and beautiful natural landscapes.

name: Freedom Park Lagos
description: A former colonial prison transformed into a memorial park and cultural center.

name: Iyake Suspended Lake
description: A mysterious suspended lake on Ado Awaye mountain with spiritual significance.

name: Oba's Palace Ile-Ife
description: The palace of the Ooni of Ife, considered the spiritual headquarters of the Yoruba people.

name: Wase Rock
description: A massive volcanic rock formation rising dramatically from the plains.

name: Jaekel House and Museum
description: A colonial-era building housing exhibitions on Lagos history and railway heritage.

name: Adiyan Beach Resort
description: A private beach resort with pristine sands, water sports facilities, and modern amenities.

name: Nnamdi Azikiwe Mausoleum
description: The burial place and memorial of Nigeria's first President, featuring a museum and library.

name: Wonderland Amusement Park Abuja
description: A modern amusement park with thrilling rides, games, and entertainment for families.

name: Obudu Mountain Tea Plantation
description: Vast tea plantations on the mountainside offering tours and fresh tea tasting.

name: Isaac Boro Park
description: A waterfront park with recreational facilities and boat rides in the Niger Delta.

name: Inyi Stream
description: A natural stream with crystal clear waters perfect for swimming and relaxation.

name: Keffi Grazing Reserve
description: A pastoral reserve showcasing traditional cattle rearing and Fulani culture.

name: Dala Hill
description: The first settlement of Kano with historical significance and panoramic city views.

name: Umuahia War Museum
description: A museum dedicated to the Nigerian Civil War with artifacts, vehicles, and exhibitions.

name: Calabar Drill Ranch
description: A sanctuary dedicated to protecting endangered drill monkeys and chimpanzees.

name: Inagbe Grand Resorts and Leisure
description: An exclusive island resort with pristine beaches, water sports, and luxury accommodations.

name: Awhum Monastery Waterfall
description: A sacred waterfall within monastery grounds offering spiritual experience and natural beauty.

name: Ahmadu Bello Stadium
description: One of Nigeria's largest sports facilities hosting major sporting and cultural events.

name: Tinapa Business Resort
description: A mega business and leisure resort with shopping, cinema, water park, and hotels.

name: Ogun Shrine Ile-Ife
description: Sacred shrine dedicated to Ogun, the Yoruba god of iron, with cultural significance.

name: Ikogosi Conference Center
description: A modern conference facility at the warm springs resort with luxury amenities.

name: Ikom Monoliths National Monument
description: Over 300 ancient stone monoliths with mysterious carvings and inscriptions.

name: Ramat Park
description: A beautiful public park with gardens, playground, and recreational facilities.

name: Abudu Tourist Beach
description: A serene beach on the Benin River with resort facilities and water activities.

name: Erin-Ijesha Glass House
description: A unique architectural structure with stunning views of the waterfall and surroundings.
